intro: Triumfetta pilosa var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are usually white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a three-lobed capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
